org.madeirahs.shared.provider
Class FTPProvider

java.lang.Object
  org.madeirahs.shared.provider.FTPProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataProvider
public class FTPProvider
extends Object
implements DataProvider

Implementation of DataProvider for obtaining data streams to/from a remote FTP server.

Author:
Brian Groenke

ka

lastPingTime

private long lastPingTime

guard

private Semaphore guard
All operations using FTPClient (with the exception for initializers) should acquire a permit from Semaphore guard first. One permit is available, and it is issued on a first-in-first-out basis.

EXIT_HOOK

private final FTPProvider.LogoutHook EXIT_HOOK
Constructor Detail

FTPProvider

public FTPProvider(String address)
            throws SocketException,
                   IOException
Connects to a FTP server without attempting a login. Note: this constructor simply calls: connect(address)

Parameters:
address - address of the remote FTP server to connect to.
Throws:
SocketException - if the socket timeout could not be set.
IOException - if the socket could not be opened.

FTPProvider

public FTPProvider(String address,
                   String username,
                   String password)
            throws LoginException,
                   SocketException,
                   IOException
Create an FTPProvider that logs into and communicates with a remote FTP server at the corresponding address, username and password. Note: this constructor simply calls: connect(address)

Parameters:
address - the remote address to connect to.
username - the username to login with.
password - the password to login with.
Throws:
LoginException - if the login was unsuccessful.
SocketException - if the socket timeout could not be set.
IOException - if the socket could not be opened.

init

protected void init()
             throws IOException
Internal initialization method called by constructors. Subclasses should also call this method if not explicitly calling super constructor.

Specification:
Sets file transaction type to BINARY_FILE_TYPE, sets local passive mode and launches FTP keepAlive thread.

Throws:
IOException

getWorkingDir

public String getWorkingDir()
Fetches the currently set working directory of the provider. The default is usually just '/' representing the absolute root directory of the system.

Specified by:

Returns:
the current working directory

getInputStream

public InputStream getInputStream(String fileName)
                           throws IOException
Fetches an input stream from the specified file on the server. Returns null if the file doesn't exist, the stream can't be opened, or the server sends a negative reply code. The returned InputStream will take care of completing the transfer when you call close().

Specified by:
getInputStream in interface DataProvider
Throws:
IOException

getOutputStream

public OutputStream getOutputStream(String fileName)
                             throws IOException
Fetches an output stream to the specified file on the server. Returns null if the stream can't be opened, or the server sends a negative reply code. The returned OutputStream will take care of completing the transfer when you call close().

Specified by:
getOutputStream in interface DataProvider
Throws:
IOException

                throws IOException

sizeOf

public long sizeOf(String fileName)
Note: accuracy of results for FTP servers are neither guaranteed nor explicitly defined. The server may or may not provide the necessary file size information and furthermore may update this information at its own discretion.

Specified by:
sizeOf in interface DataProvider
Parameters:
fileName - the name of the resource as it should be recognized by the provider (given the current configuration).
Returns:
the size (in bytes) of the file or resource. If non-existent, -1 is returned.
